summary: This document is a chain of emails from July 2019 forwarding a tip from the National Human Trafficking Hotline (Polaris) to the FBI's New York field office. The tip alleges that Jeffrey Epstein, accompanied by two young Eastern European girls, attended an Arizona State University workshop in Tempe, Arizona in February 2017, where inappropriate behavior was observed. The tip also references a prior event in 2015. The FBI's Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad in New York is noted as the lead on the case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Identified as the trafficker in the hotline tip. The tip alleges he attended an ASU workshop in 2017 with two young girls and exhibited inappropriate behavior. He is described as a major donor to the Origins Project.

persons.name: Lawrence Krauss
persons.context: Reportedly invited Jeffrey Epstein to the Origins Project workshop at Arizona State University in February 2017. The tip states complaints about Epstein's behavior were reported during a Title IX investigation into Krauss in 2018.

persons.name: Noam Chomsky
persons.context: Mentioned in the tip as the speaker at a talk on March 22, 2015, at Gammage auditorium, which Epstein attended with a young woman.

connections.description: Krauss invited Epstein to an ASU Origins Project workshop as a major donor to the project.
The tip alleges Epstein was with two young Eastern European girls (estimated 15-16 years old) at a Tempe hotel in 2017, and they were stroking him during breakfast.

events.title: ASU Origins Workshop Incident
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein attended an Arizona State University Origins Project workshop on artificial intelligence at the Tempe Mission Palms Hotel. He reportedly appeared at breakfast in a robe with two young Eastern European girls who were stroking him.

events.title: Noam Chomsky Talk at ASU
events.description: Epstein attended a Noam Chomsky talk at Gammage auditorium and brought a young woman. The tip references photos of him at this event being on file at ASU.

events.title: Title IX Investigation into Lawrence Krauss
events.description: Arizona State University conducted a Title IX investigation into Lawrence Krauss. During this investigation, complaints about Jeffrey Epstein's behavior at the 2017 workshop were reportedly reported but not addressed.

events.title: Hotline Tip Submission
events.description: An online report was submitted to the National Human Trafficking Hotline (Polaris) detailing the allegations about Epstein in Tempe, AZ.

locations: Tempe Mission Palms Hotel, Tempe, Arizona
6100 Red Hook Quarters, Suite B3, St. Thomas, VI 00802-1348 (Epstein's address listed)
keyFacts: A 2019 tip to the National Human Trafficking Hotline alleged Jeffrey Epstein was at an ASU workshop in Tempe, AZ in February 2017 with two young Eastern European girls who appeared to be 15-16 years old.
The tip describes Epstein appearing at a hotel breakfast in a robe with the two girls, who were stroking him. He was invited by Lawrence Krauss, a major donor to the ASU Origins Project.
Complaints about this 2017 incident were reportedly made during a 2018 Title IX investigation into Lawrence Krauss at ASU but were never addressed.
The tip also references a prior event on March 22, 2015, where Epstein attended a Noam Chomsky talk at ASU with a young woman.
The FBI's New York field office, specifically Squad C-20 (Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking), is identified as the lead on investigating this tip.
